result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dwane A. Bowling Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dwane A. Bowling Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for Dwane A. Bowling Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk JT  Minutes:  Case heard with 22CF1412 today.   Not guilty plea previously entered.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 09:30 am.

NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for Dwane A. Bowling Jr. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Barth advised that the DE has a new case and just appeared in intake today. Trailing new case to prelim.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Vanessa O, Donna S.
**DE MAY NOT SIGN BOND UNTIL 10/06/22 AT THE TIME HE IS SCHEDULED TO GO TO THE PROGRAM**

Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for Dwane A. Bowling Jr. Defendant Dwane A. Bowling Jr. in court. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Barth's bond motion. DE is accepted into vivitrol program and can start tomorrow. Court amends bond to a $2,000 signature bond with same conditions. DE may not sign bond until 10/06/22 at the time he is scheduled to go to the program.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for Dwane A. Bowling Jr. Defendant Dwane A. Bowling Jr. appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. DE would like to be present in person for the PLEAS.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for Dwane A. Bowling Jr. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Barth sates that this case has resolved.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
NO RECORD MADE.  Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State. Attorney Barth appears on behalf of the DE.   Clerk. M.Burke. Trailing 22CF329.

Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Barth.  Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Barth verbally requests a speedy trial, court advises that he will need to file it in writing. JS set for 09/19/22 at 8:30 with a JSH of 09/12/22 at 1:15.

NO RECORD MADE.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Barth who appears by zoom.  Clerk. M.Burke. Attorny Barth states they are waiving the speedy trial demand at this point. STC set to 08/11/22 at 1:30. JS of 08/08/22 at 8:30 is removed from the calendar.

Defendant Dwane A. Bowling appeared with Attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Vanessa O, Donna S.

01:44 PM   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Chad Shamali.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 09:15 am. $2000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). mi
